page.title: 13M25
page.content: Children from Langleybury visited the site of the new roadworks and discovered some very interesting information. Work started on this stretch in 1983 and it will not be completed until 1988. most of the 70 men working for Fairclough and the 50 working for McAlpine come originally from the north.Most workers work from 7am until 8pm daily. Heavy equipment being used includes 7 dumper trucks,1 grader,1 ackerman,4x215 caterpillars and all are working the whole time. Other contractors deliver sand and gravel in their own trucks.One country road_ Old House Lane _has had its original route altered to line up with the site of a bridge over the new road. It is felt by the children that the road is progressing well and that when complete it will help to relieve many traffic problems around London.
